inputDescriptors.name: Environment
inputDescriptors.description: Microsoft Azure Environment for the subscription

inputDescriptors.name: Scope Level
inputDescriptors.description: Scope Level for endpoint

inputDescriptors.name: Resource Group
inputDescriptors.description: Resource Group for connecting to the endpoint. Refer to link on how to create a resource group.

inputDescriptors.name: ML Workspace Name
inputDescriptors.description: Machine Learning Workspace name for connecting to the endpoint. Refer to link on how to create a ML workspace.

inputDescriptors.name: ML Workspace Location
inputDescriptors.description: Machine Learning Workspace location id for connecting to the endpoint. Refer to link to get the location ids.

inputDescriptors.name: Management Group ID
inputDescriptors.description: Management Group ID for connecting to the endpoint. Refer to Management Group link on how to create a management group.

inputDescriptors.name: Management Group Name
inputDescriptors.description: Management Group name for connecting to the endpoint. Refer to Management Group link on how to create a management group.

inputDescriptors.name: Execute on behalf of (OBO) users
inputDescriptors.description: Use credentials of deployment submitter or approver for execution. Service principal stored with the endpoint is used for read only operations.

inputDescriptors.name: Creation Mode
inputDescriptors.description: Endpoint creation can be Automatic or Manual.

inputDescriptors.name: Whether or not it is a draft
inputDescriptors.description: Some authentication schemes support creating a draft service connection without all the required details to reserve the object for safety.

inputDescriptors.name: If set, indicates that this service connection can be converted back to the original authentication scheme until this ISO 8601 time.
inputDescriptors.description: Some authentication schemes support conversions between the schemes with an option to seamlessly revert to the original scheme in a limited window of time.

inputDescriptors.name: Role Assignment Id
inputDescriptors.description: Id for contributor role in Azure subscription.

inputDescriptors.name: Azure permissions
inputDescriptors.description: Serialized list of azure permissions.

inputDescriptors.name: Service Principal Object Id
inputDescriptors.description: Id for service principal object in Microsoft Entra.

inputDescriptors.name: Application Object Id
inputDescriptors.description: Id for application object in Microsoft Entra.

inputDescriptors.name: Azure Resource Identifier
inputDescriptors.description: Resource Identifier for the azure resource

inputDescriptors.name: Identity type
inputDescriptors.description: The type of the underlying Azure identity that will be used by service connection (e.g. app registration).

data.description: Select if you want to control App registration or Managed Identity creation and Azure RBAC permissions.
Select if you can't create an App Registration. This will configure Workload identity federation on an existing Managed Identity.
Not recommended. Select to use existing Azure System-assigned Managed Identities configured on Self-hosted agents. Any job running on an agent can use its System-assigned Identity.
Not recommended. Create a App Service publish profile to connect to a specific Web App. This does not work if the Web App has disabled basic authentication.

inputDescriptors.name: Access Token
inputDescriptors.description: Access token to be used for creating the service principal

inputDescriptors.name: Role
inputDescriptors.description: Role to be assigned to the service principal

inputDescriptors.name: Scope
inputDescriptors.description: Scope on which the role should be assigned to the service principal

inputDescriptors.name: Access Fetching Method
inputDescriptors.description: How the Access Token is fetched

inputDescriptors.name: Workload Identity Federation subject
inputDescriptors.description: Workload Identity Federation subject that will be used in the subject claim of the client assertion token. This is derived from your organization, project and service connection name, and cannot be set by the user. Refer to Workload Identity Federation in AzureDevOps link on how this is used.

inputDescriptors.name: Workload Identity Federation issuer
inputDescriptors.description: Workload Identity Federation issuer that will be used in the issuer claim of the client assertion token. This is unique to an organization, and cannot be set by the user. Refer to Workload Identity Federation in AzureDevOps link on how this is used.

inputDescriptors.name: Issuer type
inputDescriptors.description: The type of the Workload Identity Federation issuer that will appear in the issuer claim of the client assertion token.

inputDescriptors.description: Scope on which the role should be assigned to the service principal

inputDescriptors.name: Access Fetching Method
inputDescriptors.description: How the Access Token is fetched

inputDescriptors.name: Credential
inputDescriptors.description: Choose credential type.

inputDescriptors.name: Certificate
inputDescriptors.description: Provide PEM file content. Include both certificate and private key content.

inputDescriptors.name: Tenant Id
inputDescriptors.description: Tenant Id of the subscription for which the MSI VM has access to

inputDescriptors.name: Publish Profile
inputDescriptors.description: Publish profile for connection to endpoint in XML format

inputDescriptors.name: Access Fetching Method
inputDescriptors.description: How the Access Token is fetched

inputDescriptors.name: Access Token
inputDescriptors.description: Access token to be used for fetching publish profile

inputDescriptors.name: Tenant Id
inputDescriptors.description: Tenant Id for connecting to the endpoint.

serviceEndpointType.name: azurerm
serviceEndpointType.description: Service connection type for Azure Resource Manager connections
